label.name: We designed an experiment and analysed t...
label.intro:
We designed an experiment and analysed the data to look at the effect of the treatments on the yield of tomatoes.

We want to put our analysis into context. This section is on the interpretation of this data.

When interpreting, you want to take into account the objectives:

1. Our first objective is to recommend the strategy of growing tomatoes that maximises the yield.

2. The second objective is for the researchers to recommend the strategy of growing tomatoes taking some account of cost of the different treatments.

Suppose you are going to grow one greenhouse of tomatoes and that the extra costs of supplementary heating and lighting are £500 and £400 for the whole greenhouse respectively with no difference in the cost of varieties. Say that a plot mean increase in yield of one unit the increase in income for your whole greenhouse is £200.

The aim here is to interpret your results, accounting for the cost of the different treatments.  

Have a think about which treatment combination is best economically.  Is this the same combination which gave the highest yield? We want to recommend the strategy of growing tomatoes, taking some account of cost of the different treatments.
